original: Elg, Viktor Hilding, journalist, Borås, f. 27/2/02 i Gävle av kont. Viktor E. o. Johanna Roman. G. 2. 42 m. Anna Lundström. Barn i för eg. äkt.: Sigrid f. 24, Lennart 29. — Stud:ex. i Gävle 21. Vol. i Gefle Dagbl. 21-23, medarb. i Borås Tidn. sed. 23, teat:-rec. ’sed. 27. Sign.: alces o. -Ic-. Styr:led. i Borås teat:fören. sed. 36, des’s sekr. 36-44, sekr. i Gbgs o. Älvsb. distr. av Sv. Bsperantoförb. ’sed. 40, ordf. i Esper.-kl. Verda Rondo i Borås 43-46. Hobbies : teat :hist., esperanto.
translated: Elg, Viktor Hilding was a journalist from Borås, born on February 27th, 1902 in Gävle to accountant Viktor E. and Johanna Roman. He married Anna Lundström in 1942 and they had two children together: Sigrid, born in 1924, and Lennart, born in 1929. Viktor passed his studentexamen in Gävle in 1921 and worked for Vol. i Gefle Dagblad from 1921-1923 before becoming a contributor to Borås Tidning, where he wrote theater reviews from 1923 onwards. His signature was "alces" or "-Ic-". He served as a board member for Borås Theater Association from 1936, acting as secretary from 1936-1944. He also served as the secretary of the Swedish Esperanto Federation's Gothenburg and Älvsborg districts from 1940 and chaired the Esperanto club Verda Rondo in Borås from 1943-1946. His hobbies included theater history and Esperanto.

structured.name: Viktor Hilding Elg
structured.description: Victor Hilding Elg was a Swedish journalist from Borås
